column4: Ontology: Door I. Definition: A door is an object or a component of design usually found in natural or man-made structures such as buildings, cars, and other establishments. It typically opens or closes to control access.A. Types   1. Hinged Doors: Most common type, opens on one side.   2. Sliding Doors: Moves by sliding along a track.   3. Rotary Doors: Rotates in a circle for individuals to enter or exit.   4. French Doors: Double doors that open in the center.   5. Pocket Doors: Slides into the wall when opened.   6. Dutch Doors: Divided into two horizontally.    7. Bi-fold Doors: Comprised of several panels that fold against each other.   B. Components  1. Door Frame: The structure in which the door is mounted.  2. Door Panel: Main, usually flat part of the door.  3. Door Handle: Used to open or close the door.  4. Hinges: Hardware used to connect the door to the frame.  5. Locks: Can be locked for the security purpose.C. Materials  1. Wood Doors: Made from a variety of hardwood or softwood species.  2. Metal Doors: Use materials such as steel or aluminum.  3. Glass Doors: Made from one or more large panels of glass.  4. Fiberglass Doors: Composites that offer the look of wood with increased durability.  5. PVC Doors: Made from durable and waterproof plastic.D. Functions  1. Privacy: To separate spaces and provide privacy.   2. Security: To protect from unauthorised access.  3. Safety: To restrict access to potentially unsafe areas.  4. Environmental: To maintain the internal environment (temperature, humidity, noise).   E. Settings  1. Interior Doors: Found within buildings, separates different rooms/spaces.  2. Exterior Doors: Leads to outdoor areas, built to withstand outdoor weather conditions.  3. Vehicle Doors: Used in cars, trucks and various types of transportational vehicles.  4. Safe Doors: Specifically designed for safes, highly secure.  F. Industries  1. Construction: Doors used in new buildings, renovations etc.  2. Manufacturing: Industries that produce various types of doors.  3. Retail: Businesses that sell doors directly to consumers.  4. Wholesale: Businesses that sell doors to retailers.
